meanings.definition: A person who speaks or behaves in a pompous or dogmatic manner.
meanings.sent1: The pontificators at the meeting wouldn't listen to anyone else's ideas.
meanings.sent2: The group of pontificators dominated the conversation with their self-important speeches.
meanings.sent3: The pontificators in the debate club took themselves very seriously.
meanings.sent4: Her father was the pontificator of the family, always giving long lectures on life.
meanings.sent5: The pontificators in the courtroom made it feel like a royal decree was being issued.

meanings.definition: To speak or behave in a pompous or dogmatic manner.
meanings.sent1: She pontificators about politics without really understanding the issues.
meanings.sent2: He pontificators during every staff meeting, making everyone roll their eyes.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to pontificators about the superiority of its favorite nap spot.
meanings.sent4: The old tree pontificators to the young saplings about the importance of roots.
meanings.sent5: The professor pontificators on the history of art with great enthusiasm.
